title: Nelson A. Rockefeller gubernatorial records, William J. Ronan, Series 29
finding_aid_title: A Guide to the Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial records, William J. Ronan, Series 29

subnotes.content: Nelson A. Rockefeller served as governor of New York from January 1, 1959, to December 18, 1973. He was the first person elected to four consecutive four-year terms as a state governor.

Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at <extref href="http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php">http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php</extref>

RAC users must abide by all applicable provisions of U.S. copyright law. Reproduction/duplication of archival items is routinely provided in accordance with "fair use." If the RAC does not hold copyright for an archival collection or items within a collection, it is the user's responsibility to contact the copyright holder, or make a fair effort to do so, prior to publication.

Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

This series is divided into the following 6 subseries:

Subseries 1 - Human Rights Issues
Subseries 2 - Reference Files
Subseries 3 - Arthur Levitt Clippings
Subseries 4 - Legislation
Subseries 5 - Speeches and Statements
Subseries 6 - General Correspondence

William J. Ronan (b. November 8, 1912) served as Secretary to Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller. He received his undergraduate degree magna cum laude at Syracuse University in 1934. He earned his Ph.D. in political science and economics at New York University. After graduating from NYU, Mr. Ronan taught there and served as administrative head of the Graduate Division of Public Service from 1939 to 1952. In 1953, he became Dean of the Graduate School of Public Administration and Social Service.

He served New York in several capacities prior to joining the Rockefeller administration. He was director of studies of the New York State Coordination Commission and conducted surveys of the State Education Department, the Civil Service Department, Public Authorities of New York State, the State Bureau of Motor Vehicles, and the nonjudicial positions in the state courts.

He became closely affiliated with Governor Rockefeller beginning in 1956, when Ronan served as the Executive Director of the Temporary State Commission on the Constitutional Convention and also of its successor organization, the Special Legislative Committee on Revision and Simplification of the Constitution. Ronan later became First Deputy City Administrator of the City of New York and served at the federal level with the Department of State and the Civil Service Commission. During his last two years as Governor Rockefeller's Secretary, Ronan also headed the Metropolitan Transit Authority.

NOTE TO RESEARCHERS

This series contains office files of William J. Ronan. They document official activities in the execution of his duties as a member of Rockefeller's staff. The actions, decisions, and exchanges of information or points of view documented here occurred in the course of proposing and implementing policies for the Rockefeller administration, political campaigns, and/or Rockefeller's personal activities. However, unless a document is specifically addressed to or from Nelson A. Rockefeller, or is referred to in a document addressed to him, it should not be assumed he saw the document or was aware of its existence or substance. Furthermore, researchers should bear in mind that staff files may contain documents or drafts addressed to Rockefeller that were never shown to him.

SCOPE AND CONTENT

This series primarily covers the years when William Ronan served Nelson Rockefeller as Secretary to the Governor, 1959 to 1966. From 1965 to 1966, Ronan also served as head of the Metropolitan Transit Authority. The bulk of this series is composed of reports prepared for Governor Rockefeller by various state departments and agencies. Some of these reports duplicate those found in Record Group 15, Series 28, Departmental Reports.
